dmca.title: DMCA / Breach of Copyright
dmca.body:
Please create a DMCA case.

-----Original Message-----
From: World Guides [mailto:info@world-guides.com] 
Sent: Monday, September 18, 2006 5:20 AM
To: Everyones Internet DMCA Agent
Subject: DMCA / Breach of Copyright

2nd Request

Unfortunately, your client http://www.bestcitiestravel.com is breaching the
copyright of our sites World Guides to Rome, Venice and Florence.

We have tried to  contact them on several occasions, but have never received a
response to our correspondence.

Therefore, as per your Acceptable Use Policy, http://www.ev1.net/
english/about/aup.asp, we wish to issue the following DMCA complaint:

1. MR. MARTIN TREASURE

2.The text copied is as follows:
http://www.bestcitiestravel.com/rome/itineraries.html
http://www.bestcitiestravel.com/venice/itineraries.html
http://www.bestcitiestravel.com/florence/weather.html
http://www.bestcitiestravel.com/florence/itineraries.html

3. The original text can be viewed here:
http://www.rome.world-guides.com/attractions.html
http://www.venice.world-guides.com/parks.html
http://www.florence.world-guides.com/life.html
http://www.florence.world-guides.com/weather.html
http://www.florence.world-guides.com/attractions.html

4.  Contact: Martin Treasure - director TravelSmart Ltd
Tel: +44 1373 454064
Email: info@world-guides.com
Address: 18 Wayside Close, Frome, Somerset, England BA11 2DL

5. I have a good faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of
is not authorized by World Guides.

6. I hereby state under penalty of perjury that this information is accurate, and
that I am authorized to act on behalf of the owner of the infringed materials.


Many thanks for your help, please advise if you require any further information.

I look forward to hearing from you shortly.

MARTIN

----------
For your clients reference we provide details of the exact material that needs to be
removed from their pages:

http://www.bestcitiestravel.com/rome/itineraries.html

The offending material reads as follows:

Castel Sant' Angelo
In the 6th century, the Castel Sant' Angelo was converted into a papal fortress and
linked to the Vatican palaces by a series of underground passages, and these have
been used by several popes when they felt under threat. The circular Castel Sant'
Angelo was originally constructed as the mausoleum of Emperor Hadrian and is now an
interesting museum. It is also here that Puccini's Tosca plunged to her death.

Mouth of Truth
Situated in the atrium of St. Mary's in Cosmedin church, this grim marble mask is
known as the Mouth of Truth or Bocca della Verit
